column2: The child is adopted with full right of inheritance.
Is informed of the murder attempt.
§Y$CLAIMANT$§! is trying to revoke the title of §Y$TITLE$§!, which has resulted in an armed conflict with §Y$TARGET$§!
This seems fishy. I should notify the supposed 'plotter'.
Howling at the moon all through the night.
$ACTOR$ and $RECIPIENT$ will be dragged into a feud

Swearing a blood oath between these two clans will make them become as if one. You swear to defend each other and for all time be allies in war and brothers in peace. Be careful however as you can only have one other clan as your blood-sworn brother.

Swearing a blood oath between these two clans will make them become as if one. You swear to defend each other and for all time be allies in war and brothers in peace. Be careful however as you can only have one other clan as your blood-sworn brother.
§Y$CLAN$§! can't already have a Blood Brother.
Do not have a Blood Oath with §Y$CLAN$§!
Declare a feud between your clan and another.
I swear to you that we shall be bonded by blood as brothers!
I do not accept your offer of blood oath.
Must not be a blood brother.

[From.GetBestName] and his people have hunted on our lands, stolen our sheep and kidnapped our women. This even though they know very well the boundaries between our clans! They truly are despicable and would betray us instantly if given the chance.
Beware the [From.Clan.GetName]. They are without honor.
With the death of [From.GetBestName] our blood oath with his family and our obligation to his people vanishes together with his life.
[From.GetFirstName] has spent his hard earned wealth on attracting and recruiting more soldiers for his mercenary band.
[From.GetFirstName] has spent his hard earned wealth on carousing with his men, wasting it on spirits and women
You have too many holdings in your personal demesne. As a nomad you can only have one holding without penalties. However you might want to keep the land yourself so you can pillage it...
Has Titles that can be Revoked

Among the peoples of the steppe, Prestige alone determines the line of succession. Legitimate children and siblings of the current ruler are eligible, but, unlike other forms of succession, only adults of the right culture can inherit.
This is the majority culture in this county.
This is the majority religion in this county.
You can never directly create a Mercenary title
You can never directly create a Holy Order title
§RThere is no valid Ambition for you to pick!§!
§RThere is no valid Focus for you to pick!§!
§Y[GetTitledFirstName]§! will not consider offers from infidels
§Y$CLAIMANT$§! can use this Casus Belli to seize all titles held by the savage, §Y$TARGET$§!, within the de jure §Y$TITLE$§!.
Feuding clans can declare wars against each other to seize a single county.
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! vassalizes non-nomadic lords and takes all other titles in the §Y[This.GetFullBaseName]§!.\n

Pagans are allowed to subjugate other pagan rulers once in their lifetime. (With the 'Become $KING$' ambition, there is no such time limit against those who control titles within the kingdom.) Free men are always willing to follow the mightiest ruler...
Pagans and Nomads can conquer single border counties without specific reasons. Norse Pagans can also take any coastal county.
Nomads can subjugate non-Nomadic realms once in their lifetime.
If our population is getting too large, we may invade another realm to seize their pasture lands! If successful, all occupied territory will be seized and all vassals will become our vassals.
Send your [GetTreasurerName] to collect extra contributions from vassals and tributary rulers. This will not please them much...

My liege, [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] has charged me with collecting extra tribute from [tribute_giver.GetTitledName]. It has not been easy going through [tribute_giver.GetPossPronoun] finances, but I finally know how much I should demand...
The [GetRootFromInsult], [From.GetTitledFirstName], is here demanding extra 'contributions' on behalf of [From.Liege.GetTitledName]!
[From.GetTitledFirstName] wisely - though reluctantly - accepted my demand for extra contributions to my liege, [Liege.GetTitledFirstName]. I fear this has hurt our relations, however...

My efficient [From.GetJobTitle], [From.GetTitledFirstName], has managed to squeeze some extra money out of [FromFrom.GetTitledName]. I fear [FromFrom.GetSubjectPronoun] is not too happy about it though...
[From.GetTitledFirstName] outrageously refused my demand for extra contributions to my liege, [Liege.GetTitledFirstName], claiming [From.GetSubjectPronoun] is under no such obligations!
The [GetRootFromFromInsult], [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName], outrageously refused to pay the extra tribute demanded by my [Root.GetTreasurerName], [From.GetTitledFirstName]!
Send your [GetMarshalName] to increase your manpower regrowth.
Send your [GetChancellorName] to improve your clan's esteem in the eyes of another clan.
Most of the Clan elders are assembled in [Root.Location.GetName]. This is a golden opportunity to tell them about the great honor of [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s clan...
My trusted [Root.GetChancellorName], [From.GetTitledFirstName], reports success from the Clan of [target_chief.Clan.GetBaseName]. Their elders now like the [Root.Clan.GetName] a lot better!
You can declare war to free yourself or one of your vassals from tributary status.
Since §Y[Recipient.GetTitledFirstName]§! is a Tribal barbarian, our vassals will not object.

§Y$CLAIMANT$§! can use this Casus Belli to seize all titles held by the infidel, §Y$TARGET$§!, within the de jure §Y$TITLE$§!. This Casus Belli is valid against neighbors, and also against infidels up to two sea zones away if either the attacker or the defender is a Muslim, or if the era of Great Holy Wars has started for the attacker's religion.
We have no units in enemy provinces where we lack Holdings
The vile excesses of [Root.GetTitledFirstName] can no longer be tolerated! We agree that [Root.GetSubjectPronoun] should be excommunicated!
Have §Y[ThirdPartyCharacter.GetBestName]§W excommunicated. This will cost you §R100§W Piety and will be viewed as an insult by [ThirdPartyCharacter.GetPossPronoun] relatives.
Have §Y[ThirdPartyCharacter.GetBestName]§W excommunicated. This will cost you §R$COST$§W Piety and will be viewed as an insult by [ThirdPartyCharacter.GetPossPronoun] relatives.
Lift the excommunication of §Y[ThirdPartyCharacter.GetBestName]§W. This will cost you §R$COST$§W Piety.
You can only Designate your Children

The great [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has declared a [Root.Religion.GetCrusadeName] against [New.GetTitledName] and the adherents of '[New.Religion.GetHighGodName]' in the [From.GetFullBaseName]! All true [Root.Religion.GetName] men are called to arms in the name of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]!\n\n The dark manifestations of [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] must be cleansed in healing flames!

The great [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has declared a [Root.Religion.GetCrusadeName] against [New.GetTitledName] and the followers of [New.Religion.GetHighGodName] in the [From.GetFullBaseName]! All true [Root.Religion.GetName] men are called to arms against the old arch-enemy!\n\n Muhammed was the mouthpiece of [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] and all his works must be destroyed!

The great [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has declared a [Root.Religion.GetCrusadeName] against [New.GetTitledName] and the [New.Religion.GetName] infidels in [From.GetFullBaseName]! All true [Root.Religion.GetName] men are called to arms against the deniers of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]!\n\n The Magi will cleanse their churches in healing flames!

The great [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has declared a [Root.Religion.GetCrusadeName] against [New.GetTitledName] and the adherents of '[New.Religion.GetHighGodName]' in the [From.GetFullBaseName]! All righteous [Root.Religion.GetName] men are called to arms in the name of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]!\n\n The idolators will learn to fear the Lord!

The great [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has declared a [Root.Religion.GetCrusadeName] against [New.GetTitledName] and the followers of [New.Religion.GetHighGodName] in the [From.GetFullBaseName]! The whole [Root.Religion.GetName] nation is called to arms against the [New.Religion.GetName] menace!\n\n The false works of the Madman must be torn down!

The great [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has declared a [Root.Religion.GetCrusadeName] against [New.GetTitledName] and the [New.Religion.GetGroupName] infidels in [From.GetFullBaseName]! All true [Root.Religion.GetName] men are called to arms against the old oppressors!\n\n The Lord will prove us right!
Temples provide moderate income and good levies. They may also give Piety to their holder, and the holder's liege.
Arrange a betrothal with the most eligible potential spouse.

In Crusader Kings II, you play as a succession of medieval rulers from a single dynasty. There is no set goal, but the world is filled with ambitious rivals... Secure more land to increase your power and protect your family.

As a ruler, your first priority is to secure an heir. If you do not have a legitimate heir when your character dies, the game will end. Other pressing matters appear as Alerts along the top of the screen!

You cannot hold infinite amounts of land yourself. To expand, you will need to rely on vassal rulers. Keep them happy with titles and gifts lest they decide to revolt! The game will end in 1452, if your line can stay in power that long...
You have chosen to play as a [Culture.GetName] [Religion.GetName] [PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle].
$NAME$ Bishops may pay tax to the Pope rather than their secular liege
The $HEAD_TITLE$ can grant the Invasion Casus Belli
The $HEAD_TITLE$ can grant Claims on titles
No opinion penalty against female rulers and heirs
Multiple Patriarchs - the five Pentarchs and Autocephalous Patriarchs under Kings
Fairly weak rulers can Prepare Invasions
Rulers can raid infidel neighbors for loot
Vassals do not mind if their levies are raised
Rulers can marry close kin to improve vassal opinions
$NAME$ men can have up to §Y$NUM$§! wives (unless they are allowed to have concubines)
$NAME$ men can take up to §Y$NUM$§! Concubines
Non-pagans (with low tech) have a very low Supply Limit in $NAME$ counties
Rulers lose Prestige if at peace for too long
A religious head (the $HEAD_TITLE$) can be created by a special Decision
$TITLE_NAME$ is held by a secular ruler, and can be destroyed or created normally
There is always a $HEAD_TITLE$, landed or not
There is (and can exist) no religious head
Caste Traits have great effect on opinions

Much lower chance of provincial revolts
§Y*§! Large bonuses to all vassal opinions
§Y*§! Rulers can hold larger Demesnes
§Y*§! Rulers cannot declare Holy Wars
Can designate any valid offspring as the heir
§Y*§! Can only declare limited Holy Wars against non-Indian religions
§Y*§! Can only declare Holy Wars against non-Indian religions
§Y*§! Women may hold all councillor positions\n§Y*§! Women may lead armies

Feudal government revolves around the oath between liege and vassal, and Feudal lords can only directly own so many Holdings before they must start to rely on vassals - whose loyalty may vary... There are several Succession Laws to pick between - each with its own merits. The Centralization Law controls the maximum size of your Demesne and the number of direct vassals you can have.

The Arabic Iqta system is similar to the Feudal system - rulers must rely on land holding vassals or varying loyalty and ambition. The maximum number of vassals and the number of Holdings you can directly own are controlled by the Centralization Law. However, there is only one form of Succession available - the chaotic 'Open' type, where the son with most land inherits.

Nomads are not very interested in owning Holdings, only in more grazing land for their sheep and horses. Gameplay centers around the Population of the tribe and the Manpower it provides. Empty Holdings slots in open terrain increases the maximum population. While Nomads can have normal vassals, they are mostly concerned with managing the other, few but powerful, major Clans of the tribe.
The leaders of regular republics are randomly chosen from among the citizenry. This kind of republic is not playable, since there is no dynastic persistence between the generations of rulers.

Tribes are settled but agrarian. Each county can only have one Tribal 'Holding', representing the entire local tribal population - the more empty Holding slots, the more powerful the Tribal Holding. Tribal rulers are limited to the 'Elective Gavelkind' Succession Law, which tends to fragment the realm between sons on the death of the chief.
Theocracies, like minor republics, are unplayable. Rulers are appointed or elected from among the ecclesiarchy, and there is no dynastic persistence between generations of rulers.
$NAME$ dynasties may grow Decadent if the religion also allows it
Vassals of other religions pay the Jizya tax
Laws are changed by expending Piety, not by votes
Rulers can raid infidel neighbors for loot
Other vassals will not object to vassal retraction
De Jure Law effects are ignored
Male rulers can take up to §Y$NUM$§! Concubines
Rulers can raid infidel neighbors for loot
Powerful 'minor' clans can rise up in revolt, demanding a place among the major clans.
Will not join wars against spouse (§Y[GetTitledName]§!)!

Nomadic Tribes are always dominated by a number of major Clans. Keeping the clan chiefs in line - and balancing their number and power - should be a priority for any Khan. Have too few Clans, and one is likely to emerge by force if necessary. Have too many Clans, and they will be unhappy about lack of grazing land.

Each Clan has an opinion of every other Clan, called Clan Sentiments. The Clan chiefs must respect these sentiments, which is reflected in their normal Opinions of the other chiefs. Keep a careful eye on the Clan Sentiments to prevent internal strife before it happens.

Clans are always semi-autonomous and must be called to war even against a rebellion by another Clan. Worse, each Clan (even the ruling one) can only be allied to one other Clan, by swearing a Blood Oath. It is also common for Clans to be feuding, which allows them to war with each other for land. Positive or negative treatment of one Clan will also affect the Sentiments of any feuding or Blood Brother clan, as appropriate...
The key to managing the Clans is to use the special actions available to you - 'Split Clan', 'Settle Feud', etc.
León and Asturias are now one kingdom
The Kingdoms of León and Asturias are to stay united forever, so there will be only one crown and one king ruling them forever.
[From.GetTitledName] has decided to unite the Kingdoms of León and Asturias as a single entity - León.
After centuries of subjugation, Castille has grown in power and autonomy. It is time to be recognized as an equal by the other rulers in our region!
[From.GetTitledName] has been created King of Castille due to the prestige of [From.GetPossPronoun] independent rule over [From.GetPossPronoun] ancestral lands.
After centuries of subjugation, Portugal has grown in power and autonomy. It is time to be recognized as an equal by the other rulers in our region!
[From.GetTitledName] has been created King of Portugal due to the prestige of [From.GetPossPronoun] independent rule over [From.GetPossPronoun] ancestral lands.
The little County of Aragon, created by the Franks long ago, has become such a prestigious title that it has almost been considered a Kingdom... Now there is no almost about it!
[From.GetTitledName] has been created King of Aragon due to the prestige of [From.GetPossPronoun] independent rule over [From.GetPossPronoun] ancestral lands.
A powerful minor Clan has risen up in [Root.GetName], led by their charismatic chieftain. They demand a place among the major clans!
We shall see who proves the stronger!
A powerful minor Clan has risen up in [From.GetName], led by their charismatic chieftain. They demand a place among the major clans!
The minor Clan rising has gained more support in [Root.GetName], reinforcing the ongoing revolt!
The minor Clan rising has gained more support in [From.GetName], reinforcing the ongoing revolt!
This title was given to women in the families within the Mongolian nobility.
The Mongolian warriors used eagles to aid them while hunting. Being responsible for the training of these companions was a great honor.

Word has reached us that an ambitious Khan from beyond the great mountains has set out to unite the clans of the great steppe. It is also said by men who read the stars that this Khan is destined to become the ruler of the world.
What could those equestrians hope to accomplish?
That should be nothing to worry about.
No-one will rule over our people!

A Mongolian ruler who manages to unite the clans of the Great Steppe may claim the title of Genghis Khan, Greatest of Khans. While unifying the people of the step is quite a challenge, fullfilling the prophecy of ultimately becoming the leader of the world may prove to be even harder.

A Mongolian ruler who manages to unite the clans of the Great Steppe may claim the title of Genghis Khan, Greatest of Khans. While unifying the people of the steppe is quite a challenge, fullfilling the prophecy of ultimately becoming the leader of the world may prove to be even harder.

The many Khans of the steppe have been rallied under the same banner. The leader that managed to unite them all is [From.GetFirstName] of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. The people of the steppe now call their leader Genghis Khan, Greatest of Khans, and have set their minds not only on ruling the steppes but to spread throughout the world. Is there anyone who can stop the thundering armies of thousands of hooves?
Something has to be done to stop them!
[From.GetFirstName] truly is the Greatest of Khans!
I'll use this knowledge to my advantage!

More than a month has passed since you set out with your expedition, and you have yet to find a suitable trade partner anywhere. Your crew is homesick, and have now turned the company around to head home.
As your mother's heir it falls upon you to bring her to the mountains. She will be offered to the birds of prey, and in death she will generously share her flesh with all living creatures.

Without any heirs of her own, it falls upon you to bring your sister to the mountains. She will be offered to the birds of prey, and in death she will generously share her flesh with all living creatures.
I should take the bird out for some hunting instead.
In the wrestling pit people fight for glory and enjoyment.
At the shrine people can practice the main religious rituals and ceremonies.
Wagons pulled by oxen are used to move villages and supplies. Yurts were commonly moved fully assembled to achieve a mobile community.
Sheep wool is used to make felt in addition to the meat that the sheep provide.
Regular hunting activities are arranged in the region.
A competition to bring forth the fastest riders.
Checkpoints for a fast messenger system giving supplies and fresh horses to allow messengers to travel huge distances every day.
The most proven heroes of the realm gather to discuss everything from politics to tactics.
The cattle livestock provides meat and works as pack animals.
Dried meat work as effective field rations for the armies.
A harbor village allowing small transport and trade ships to dock and be maintained.
Fishers use the nearby water to provide an additional source of food.
Turning the wool into felt for use in clothes or the construcion of tents.
Crafted from bamboo, horn and sinew, small composite bows are agile enough to be used effectively on horseback.
Rectangular leather pieces are laced together to form a sturdy armor.
The majority of the residences in the steppe consists of felt huts known as gers.
The camel breeder makes sure that there is a steady supply of sturdy camels.
These shrines gives the oppotunity for people to worship deities of different religions.
A meeting place for the different clans in the nomad realm to discuss various internal affairs.
A mild alcoholic beverage derived from mare's milk.
The local minting of coins allows more trade to be conducted in the province.
Small barricades have been errected around the camp to protect it from bandits and raiders.
In the camp elephants are prepared to take part in military campaigns.

Your vassal limit indicates how many direct vassals you can have at count tier or higher, excluding nomad clans. Having too many direct vassals will negatively affect the amount of taxes and levies you get from your vassals, and you might lose the grip of your vassals upon death.
You have become the ruler of a Nomadic realm and are therefore no longer allowed to continue playing.
All empty demesne provinces will get a §YTribal holding§!\n
I can choose to settle my tribe permanently.
I can choose to leave behind my nomad way of life and become a Feudal ruler.
[From.GetDynName] settled as a tribe in [From.GetHerHis] domains, leaving their old nomad life behind them.
[From.GetDynName] adopted an Iqta system in [From.GetHerHis] domains, abandoning the old tribal ways.
[From.GetDynName] adopted a feudal system in [From.GetHerHis] domains, leaving their old nomad life behind them.
[From.GetDynName] adopted an Iqta system in [From.GetHerHis] domains, leaving their old nomad life behind them.
At least §Y$VAL$§!% more §Y$FIRST_TYPE$s§! in $FIRST_LOCATION$ per §Y$SECOND_TYPE$s§! in $SECOND_LOCATION$ (currently $FIRST_VAL$/$SECOND_VAL$ §Y$FIRST_TYPE$s§!)
The King of the [FromFrom.Culture.GetName]s, [FromFrom.GetBestName], has decided to settle down in [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetName], making it [FromFrom.GetHerHis] new homeland.
The King of the [FromFrom.Culture.GetName]s, [FromFrom.GetBestName], has decided to settle down in [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetName], making it [FromFrom.GetHerHis] new tribal homeland.
We've decided to offer you the position of commander, do you accept?
We have decided to revoke your title as commander.
Converting to [Root.Religion.GetName] would bring your clans closer.
Has not adopted the faith of another clan in 10 years\n
Absorbing a Clan will help you grow in power, but other Clans might see this as a threat.
§Y[Recipient.GetBestName]§! refused the absorption of the §Y[Recipient.Clan.GetName]§! clan, requested by §Y[Actor.GetBestName]§!
This will lower §Y[Recipient.GetTitledFirstName]§!'s opinion of you by §R$VAL$§!.
[Recipient.GetHerHis] Blood Brother §Y$BLOOD_BROTHER$§!'s Clan Sentiment towards you will also be lowered by §R$VAL$§!.
Other clan vassals will see this as a tyrannical act, decreasing their Sentiment towards you by §R$VAL$§!.
Other clan vassals will not mind, as they think there are too many clans in the realm.
I humbly accept your decision to absorb the [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] Clan, though it grieves me deeply.
I will not allow you to steal my people without a fight! You are no longer my Khan.
§Y$TITLE$§! will no longer be an adventurer title.\n
§Y$TITLE$§! will no longer be a temporary title.\n
Resign from your duty as a Commander
To avoid injuries or in order to lead your own troops, it might be a good idea to Resign from your duty as a Commander.
§Y[Actor.GetBestName]§W has Resigned from [Actor.GetHerHis] duty as Commander.
I have decided to step down as your Commander.
Clan Sentiment difference between §Y$FIRST$§! and §Y$SECOND$§! lower than §Y$VAL$§!
Clan Sentiment difference between §Y$FIRST$§! and §Y$SECOND$§! at least §Y$VAL$§!
The following Special Minor Titles can be granted:\n$LIST$
§YCommanders§! are the only ones after the §YMarshal§! and the ruler who are allowed to command armies.
[FromFrom.GetBestName], leader of the [FromFrom.Clan.GetName] Clan, has adopted our religion.
[FromFrom.GetBestName], leader of the [FromFrom.Clan.GetName] Clan, has adopted the faith of [FromFromFrom.GetFirstName] and become [FromFromFrom.Religion.GetName].
Upgrade the Fort of [Root.GetName] to a City
Upgrade the Fort of [Root.GetName] to a Castle
Upgrade the Fort of [Root.GetName] to a Temple
Upgrade the Fort of [Root.GetName] to a Tribal Holding
§Y[Actor.GetBestName]§W has Formed a Blood Oath with [Recipient.GetBestName].
§Y[Recipient.GetBestName]§W refused to form a Blood Oath with [Actor.GetBestName].
I propose we form a Blood Oath to help each other throughout our lifespan.
Absorbed the Clan of my Blood Brother
§Y[Recipient.GetBestName]§W refused to Settle the Feud with the [Actor.Clan.GetName].

[Actor.GetBestName] has sent a messenger bringing luxurious gifts in hopes that these extravagencies shall make me forget the conflict between the [Actor.Clan.GetName] and the [Recipient.Clan.GetName].
The feud has finally come to an end and our people can again know peace.
The [From.Clan.GetName] are stubborn and refuses to put our issues behind us.

Splitting Clans is a good way to keep your Clan vassals weak. Creating too many Clans however will make them upset about the competition. The new Clan will appreciate the power given to them and be loyal to you, for a while..
§Y[Recipient.GetBestName]§! refused the splitting of the §Y[Recipient.Clan.GetName]§! clan, requested by §Y[Actor.GetBestName]§!
Split the §Y[Recipient.Clan.GetName]§! and give §Y$TITLE$§! to a new Clan.
This will lower §Y[Recipient.GetTitledFirstName]§!'s Clan Sentiment of you by §R$VAL$§!.
[Recipient.GetHerHis] Blood Brother §Y$BLOOD_BROTHER$§!'s Clan Sentiment towards you will also be lowered by §R$VAL$§!.
All clan vassals will become upset as there is already enough clans in the realm, decreasing their Sentiment towards you by §R$VAL$§!.
Other clan vassals will not mind, as they do not think there are too many clans in the realm.
I humbly accept your decision to split my Clan, though it grieves me deeply.
I will not allow you to steal my people without a fight! You are no longer my Khan.
Splitted the Clan of my Blood Brother
Can only be used against self or the most Populous Clan vassal.
[Recipient.GetBestName] must have a valid province without a capital settlement to take.
You have §R$NUM$§!/§Y$MAX$§! Clans, giving you a Clan Sentiment penalty towards all Clan vassals.

The Desired Clan Size is determined by the size of the realm. Having too many clans will negatively affect the Clan Sentiment of all vassal clans towards their liege. Being too far below the Desired Clan Size will put the Khan at the risk of a Clan Revolt. When the Maximum Possible Clan Size has been reached, you can no longer use the Split Clan interaction and any subjugated Nomad will become a Tribal ruler instead.

You hold too much land compared to the other Clans. Hand out §Y$NUM$§! counties or you might face revolts from the existing Clans as it negatively affects their §YClan Sentiment§! of you. You can also face a §YMinor Clan Rising§! revolt to seize its rightful position among the major Clans...
I have decided to revoke the lands of [ThirdPartyTitle.GetFullName] and give it to a new clan. Failure to hand it over peacefully will lead to war.
I have decided to seize your lands and merge your clan with mine. Failure to hand over your lands peacefully will lead to war.
Capital is in a Steppe, Desert or Plains province
Capital is in a Mountains, Hills or Arctic province
This building is only active while
§Y[GetTitledFirstName]§! is not allowed to move the capital again in $MONTHS$ months - unless it's back to the traditional capital of [PrimaryTitle.GetName].
Are you sure you want to move your court to $PROVINCE$, making it your capital?
$GOVERNMENT$ Rulers can only do this once in their lifetime.
You will not be able to change capital again for $MONTHS$ months.
I can upgrade the Fort of [Root.County.GetBaseName] to a prosperous City.
I can upgrade the Fort of [Root.County.GetBaseName] to a glorious Castle.
I can upgrade the Fort of [Root.County.GetBaseName] to a holy Temple.
I can upgrade the Fort of [Root.County.GetBaseName] to a Tribal Holding.
Nomads can only move their Capital to provinces with an empty primary holding slot.
All Trade Zones, separated by their owner.
This Trade Zone is owned by the §Y$FAMILY$§! Family of §YThe $REPUBLIC$§!
This Trade Zone is owned by §Y$HOLDING$§!
Spymaster - Scheme, build spy network, study technology.
Court Chaplain - Proselytize, research cultural tech, improve religious relations.

You can have up to three concubines in addition to your wife. Concubines are not truly married, but will bear their liege's legitimate children. A woman who is the prisoner of a ruler can be forced to become his concubine, even if she is already married.
Advancements in your Capital Holding of $NAME$
Local knowledge of $TECH$ in $NAME$ increased to level §Y$LEVEL$§!
Local progress of $TECH$ advancement in $NAME$ increased to §Y$PROG$§!
You can only move your Capital during peacetime.
Members desire §Y[From.GetBestName]§! as the new leader for the §Y[This.GetFullName]§!. When sufficiently powerful, §Y[From.GetBestName]§! may present an ultimatum to §Y[From.Liege.GetBestName]§!

You have shown yourself weak and I speak for all the clans when I say that it is time for you to hand over the bridle to someone more worthy.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
The weak Khan has agreed to our demands and have to surrender himself to us.
A faction led by disgruntled Clan-Chiefs have ended without bloodshed as the previous Khan surrendered.
I surrender myself to you [Root.GetTitledName] and only beg of you to have mercy upon me and my house...
Your clan has served us well, you shall live for now...
Cowards like you have no place among us!
Because of their different way of governance, none of your Clans will object to the imprisonment of this outsider.
Because of their different way of governance, none of your Clans will object to the execution of this outsider.
